name: Sonesta Hotel Philadelphia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted to watch the (now very sad) Eagles playoff games aganist the Saints, but did not want to drive after a few drinks. I went on Priceline at the last minute, tried to get a 4* property and was unsuccessful. I took my chances and bid on a 3* hotel in Center City Philadelphia and got the Crowne Plaza for $60/night.
reviews.title: Impressed the second time around...

likes.liked: — Excellent service, comfortable beds, nice rooms, sleep amentity package
likes.disliked: — Tired hallways leading to the rooms, main lobby could stand to be refurbished

reviews.text: We stayed at this property a few years ago and what we recalled was a tiny room next to the elevator. Nonetheless, we remembered it was clean and hoped for the best.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This experience far outshone our previous stay at Crowne Plaza. The lobby is not all that large or impressive, but we were greeted and directed to check-in as soon as we entered the hotel. Check-in was a breeze - I requested a king bed and they found one without issue. We stayed in Room 1094 - it was a great room. Big and clean with a very comfortable king bed. Also in the room were two chairs, a desk, end tables and an armoire with a TV.
reviews.title: Nice place, great price on Hotwire

likes.liked: — Large guest room, friendly staff, fancy amenities (sleep package, etc.), restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is extremely small, with just a bathtub/shower and a toilet. There is no room to move around; however, it was VERY clean and the shower was powerful with a great heat lamp. The sink/vanity was outside the bathroom. which was just fine. One special touch is the sleep amentity package which they give all guests complimentary (ear plugs, eye mask, relaxation CD and linen spray) - really nice.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: During our stay they did not have any room service available since they are refurbishing their kitchen, so in lieu of that, they offered a complimentary continental breakfast to all guests. It was relatively basic - cereal, fruit, pasteries, bagels, coffee/tea, bottled juices/water - but included in the $60 price tag, it was an absolute bargain!
reviews.title: Not really enjoyable

likes.liked: — was located in the center of town

reviews.title: It was good but 4 stars is reaching
reviews.text: The crown plaza was at best a 3 and a half star hotel, the things I did not like about this place was its way over priced $31 per night parking, there was much confusion everytime I picked my car up and dropped it off as to weather I was a hotel guest or not, very poor ticket management system and sleeping valet guy does not mix. Our room that we reserved on a private floor was not ready however after 20 mins waiting at the desk we where givin another room at a greatly reduced rate. The bed was extreamly comfortable and the staff was pretty nice. the bathroom was extreamly tiny and hard to move arround in. and the view of the city was very poor. Overall though I have stayed in worse and better. closing remarks. I would stay here again if it where at the reduced rate. but I am very happy that I did not pay the full rate for my stay here because I do not feel it would have been worth it.

Had to stay at the Crowne Plaza for a wedding. The staff was not helpful one bit. Housekeeping and security were actually loud through the night. The room was borderline dirty. Stay at the Lowes...MUCH better. The staff also told us the bar would be open until 2:00am. We specifically asked upon our return from the wedding. At 12:30, of course the bar was closed. The staff was rude and clueless when questioned. Parking was a mess. I am easy to please, but this place really bothered me. Never again will I even think about this place.
reviews.title: Not good

reviews.text: While the outside of the hotel and the lobby are not spectacular, and the rooms look rather standard, at first blush, this turned out to be a very nice hotel to stay at! The bed was very comfortable, lots of pillow (many more than I needed!), nice linens, great mattress. It's part of their "Sleep Advantage" program, that even supplies ear plugs, a sleep mask, a lavendar spritzer for spraying the sheets, and a CD to help you relax at night. They had a high-tech alarm clock that included a CD player. And the bathroom, while plain, had great toiletries and an excellent shower head. Everything functioned well and was very clean. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a mile or 2 from the historic distance, but still easily walking distance, and is very close to restaurants, shopping, and the Rittenhouse Square. I'd be happy to stay here again if I return to Philadelphia!
reviews.title: Basic decor, great bed and incidentals

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds, well apointed, friendly staff

reviews.title: Loved the hotel - pub disappointing
reviews.text: We found ourselves on the top floor (25) of this hotel - gulp!! But, it was a decent "Sleep Advantage" room, nice and clean and in an excellent location. Bathroom very compact. The reception staff were extremely friendly, which is more than I can say for the Business Centre Receptionist!!! We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and visited the Elephant & Castle pub on our first evening and had a superb meal. We decided to visit the pub again on our second evening and were extremely disappointed - 3 out of 4 meals were returned as cold (yes, should have been hot). We did notice that there was a complete change of staff from the first night. In fact 2 of the meals (steaks) were returned no less than 3 times and were still inedible. They were very apologetic and they only charged us for 2 meals and our drinks but we were so looking forward to our evening. Needless to say, the tip got smaller and smaller! Having asked for the steaks to be "well done" they were, but on the outside only, and raw inside with blood oozing. On our third night we gave it a miss. What a shame! The hotel had a decent sized pool on the 8th floor with a good sitting area.

Got this hotel for $85 after all taxes and fees on hotwire. We found the location to be pretty good as everything was within blocks. 3 blocks from Rittenhouse Square (shopping), and a couple of blocks from mass transit (trolley). It is quite far from the historic district, but Philly has a $1 per ride bus that runs all summer every 12 minutes. Unless you HAVE to be in the thick of things, save the money and stay in Center city. Parking is now $31 (ouch), but its directly adjacent to the hotel and there's Starbucks across the street. Neighborhood is good.
reviews.title: Nice spot

reviews.text: I was ready to give this place a four star rating, but then I read some of the other reviews and remembered some of the minor things I didn't like so much.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel, with some drawbacks

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff are a little spacy

reviews.text: The room (king size bed) was very large and very comfortable. You are right in the heart of Center City, so there is a lot of shopping and restaurants around, and very close to public transportation. City Hall is about three blocks east and Rittenhouse Square is about three blocks south. The drawback is that there is some traffic noise.
reviews.title: Nice Place, but a lot of Minor Service Issues

likes.liked: — Extra touches, nice place, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room wasn't ready on check-in (it was about 1:30 PM), so I had to wait a little while for that. The guy who checked me out forgot to scan my valet ticket, so I had to go back to the front desk after checking out. Other than that, the staff is outstanding...the bellhops were very friendly and the concierge provided a whole list of recommended restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Crowne Jewel in Philly

reviews.text: I'm a little unsure about the parking. They only offer valet service at $31.00 per night. I called to ask if there were self-park lots nearby and they said the closest was 6 blocks away. There is an abundance of garages in the neighborhood, so I don't know if they were just trying to screw me or what. Nevertheless, $30-$35 seems to be the going rate for most Center City hotels.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Crowne Plaza!

reviews.text: Like some said, the elevators are pretty slow.
reviews.title: Just as sweet the second time

reviews.text: Because we have young children, I called to verify accomodations. I was told we needed a separate room for the children. There is NO WAY my babies are staying in a separate room, in a strange city. Would you pay for 2 rooms?? They need to post they just don't want children. Our story does have a happy ending. We found a hotel that will accomodate our children. We payed half of what this hotel is charging and according to the reviews I've yet to read a negative add at the place we are staying. What amazes me is the booking agent didn't have an issue with the children, but she called the front desk to verify and they were very firm 2 rooms (may be adjoining)!!
reviews.title: Children/Infants not accepted

likes.liked: — This hotel was across the street from my our conference

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference and was not disappointed. My room was small but I was alone so it didn't matter. The bedding was very comfortable and inviting. The room was clean and nicely decorated. No refrigerator but there was a thermostat. The conferance facilities were nice and the service good. The conference food was only so so though. The hotel is just a few blocks from Rittenhouse Square and the good shopping on Walnut Street. It is only 1/2 mile from 30th street Amtrak.
reviews.title: good hotel for a stay in Philadelphia

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel because of a conference I attended in the area. Initial customer service (check-in-guy) was very good, as well as one bell-hop. Everyone else had horrible customer service skills.
reviews.title: Small dirty bathroom, poor customer service

reviews.text: The room was dark, most likely to hide the dirt . The bathroom was small and there was remains of shaved hair all over the sink as well as a dirty towel in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service, Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza - Philadelphia on business this past March. I felt everyone was highly professional and went out of their way to accommodate all guests.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel in a Good location

likes.liked: — Location, staff, spacious room, quiet, comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — Philadelphia needs to clean up its act- too much street vulgarity- even in this area

reviews.title: Something's missing...
reviews.text: namely, flowers and champagne. A Philadelphia friend left these items for me to surprise me (although NOT at the check-in desk). He even gave a personal photo of me to a staff member . I never received any of the above items and to add insult to injury, our room was not cleaned, the staff claiming we had hung out the "do not disturb" sign (which we didn't). I realize that mistakes can and do happen, but in a hospitality industry I would've expected a greater sense of sympathy than I received.

reviews.title: Excellent Location near Rittenhouse Square
reviews.text: I booked twenty rooms at the Crowne Plaza as part of an excursion to see the King Tut exhibition at the Franklin Institute, which is within easy walking distance of this hotel. Check-in went smoothly. Elevators are fast and efficient and staff is friendly...Hank at the lobby door is a friendly face that you will see again and again. I enjoyed my overall experience here and would definitely book again.

reviews.title: take advantage of the KIing Tut package
reviews.text: The lobby of the hotel is somewhat small and not very attractive, but the rooms are quite large and well appointed. Furnishings include a large desk, comfortable desk chair, chaise lounge, and a number of side chairs. Fabrics are spotless and pleasing to the eye. Lighting is excellent. The bath is small, but clean and furnished with high quality amenities. Lots of towels are provided and I had no problem with hot water.

reviews.title: Very pleasant stay
reviews.text: The television offers 40 free stations and the room is equipped with a dream machine that will play CD's. The hotel gives each guest a sleep therapy CD, sleep mask, ear plugs to assist in getting guests a good night's sleep...all in a nice packet...Guests will also find in-room coffee/tea, ironing board and iron, and high speed internet connections. There wasn't a microwave or refrigerator in my room.

reviews.title: Traveler, Beware...
reviews.text: Finally, the location is wonderful. The hotel is just four blocks from Rittenhouse Square and is near plenty of very good shopping, within walking distance to many of the museums and many good restaurants. The Philadelphia Museum of Art is just a $6 cab ride. There is a very good pub called Elephant and Castle in the hotel which serves pub fare that is satisfying, but nearby is a diner (where breakfast can be had for around $5), excellent Thai food, a Smith & Wollensky, and other dining establishments.

reviews.title: Beware of Parking Problems
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for three nights - the room was OK - the location was excellent - the sink in the bathroom wouldn't drain. Water would sit in it for hours. On the third and last night just after midnight my door was opened. The security latch was on the door so the person couldn't get in. I called the desk. I told them that someone had entered my room. They did not send security. They did not call the police. I stayed up the rest of the night. The next day on my way to the train station the desk didn't mention the incident. I called and asked to speak to a manager when I got to NYC. It took three weeks and several phones calls before a manager called to tell me that they had run a check on the electronic lock on my hotel room. They had sent an plumber to the room to fix the drain in the bathroom that wouldn't drain after midnight I was told that was normal. They sent me a coupon for a free night in the hotel. It was a bad hotel experience for me.

reviews.title: Overall, Great Weekend!
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a room at the Crowne Plaza through Hotwire for the Easter holiday weekend. While the price for the rooms was fine we were disappointed wth the inadequate parking accomodations.

The 'valet' service is not affiliated with the hotel but adjacent to the lobby. Be aware that while the location is convenient the service itself is not. In most hotels you are able to call down to the front desk to request your car be pulled forward. At the CP you will need to bring your ticket downstairs and then wait in line for your car to be brought to you. During a busy check-out time this could take up to 30 minutes. Definitely don't be in a hurry or have your car pulled around in advance of any flight or other time-sensitive meeting.
reviews.title: Crown Plaza + King Tut = Great Weekend

reviews.text: Well We purchased the room last second on Hotwire, for only 80.00 (Thanks Hotwire!!)...
reviews.title: Ehh it was ok

likes.disliked: — Size of the rooms and bathrooms

reviews.text: We arrive at the hotel around 10:30pm...As we check in, we were told that all the standard rooms are booked, so we would be upgraded to their Club suites...So of course we were happy abou that...So we go up to the 22nd floor...
reviews.title: Mixed Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We open the door, and holy cow was the room small...For 3 people and an upgraded room we thought for sure it would be a little larger...I've stayed in regular Holiday Inns whose rooms were twice the size as this...Not to mention the bathroom was "literally" so small that if you're in it, you have to stand in the bathtub to open the door.
reviews.title: business yes, holiday no

likes.disliked: — the clean was never cleaned during our entire stay

reviews.text: Other than the size, the room was nice and clean. The beds were very comfortable, and the view was ok. If we had payed the regular rate of 180.00/night I would've been dissapointed. But for 80.00 we were content. I would recommend this room if you can get it on hotwire for the rate we paid, but for regular price (unless your a midget) no way...
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms, rough lobby

reviews.text: FYI - They do have a nice CD that they leave in the room that helps relax you when you go to sleep, definitely liked that.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Crowne Plaza on Market st

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my low expectations in the quality of the room amenities, bedding, and linens.
reviews.title: clean, quiet, convenient, but costly parking

reviews.text: However, the bathroom toilet didn't flush properly and the bathroom door was misaligned with the hinge, causing a disturbing screech each time the door was opened. But for less than $70 on priceline after tax I can't complain, even though the elevators are noticeably slow and the business district isn't ideal for tourists like me.
reviews.title: Location, location, location !

reviews.text: Nice that there was a Starbucks across the street and a pleasant enough 15 minute walk to Reading Terminal Market.
reviews.title: OK if paid under $100
Great location
reviews.text: Staff pleasant and unassuming.

description: Experience the Best of Philly during your stay at our convenient and newly refreshed hotel. The only hotel located on Market Street west of City Hall we are surrounded by Philadelphia's most prominent businesses, hospitals, universities and government offices. The hotel is located just blocks from the Pennsylvania Convention Center, Amtrak's 30th Street Station and Philadelphia's historic sites and attractions. The Philadelphia Museum of Art, Liberty Bell, National Constitution Center, Independence Hall & Philadelphia Zoo are just a few of the Philadelphia attractions to experience during your getaway. Walk to Center City businesses, fine dining, upscale shopping, museums, Rittenhouse Square, Avenue of the Arts-Theatre District & Antique Row. Experience professional sports with the Philadelphia Eagles and Phillies or visit top rated golf courses in the tri-state area. Plan your visit to the Franklin Institute's exciting Real Pirates Exhibit with our VIP Packages. Relax at our seasonal outdoor rooftop pool with views of the city. The Sonesta Hotel Philadelphia features great hotel deals and packages for family travel and weekend escapes
